back off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to move backwards, away from someone or something
back off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: She backed off and then turned and ran.
back off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to stop telling someone what to do, or stop criticizing them, especially so that they can deal with something themselves
back off.translation[0].definitions[1].e: I think you should back off for a while.
Back off, Marc! Let me run my own life!
back off.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to stop supporting something, or decide not to do something you were planning to do
back off.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Jerry backed off when he realized how much work was involved.
The company has backed off from investing new money.
